name: The powerfree part of the n-th biquadratefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^If[e < 2, 1, 0]; s[n_] := Module[{fct = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[fct[[;; , 2]], # < 4 &], Times @@ f @@@ fct, Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 4, print1(prod(i = 1, #f~, f[i, 1]^if(f[i, 2] < 2, f[i, 2], 0)), ", ")));}
xref: Similar sequences: A382902, A382903, A382904, A382906.
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 08 2025

name: The largest cubefree divisor of the n-th biquadratefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^Min[e, 2]; s[n_] := Module[{fct = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[fct[[;; , 2]], # < 4 &], Times @@ f @@@ fct, Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 4, print1(prod(i = 1, #f~, f[i, 1]^min(f[i, 2], 2)), ", ")));}
xref: Similar sequences: A382903, A382904, A382905, A382906.
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 08 2025

name: The largest cubefree unitary divisor of the n-th biquadratefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^If[e < 3, e, 0]; s[n_] := Module[{fct = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[fct[[;; , 2]], # < 4 &], Times @@ f @@@ fct, Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 4, print1(prod(i = 1, #f~, f[i, 1]^if(f[i, 2] < 3, f[i, 2], 0)), ", ")));}

name: The squarefree kernel of the n-th biquadratefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: s[n_] := Module[{fct = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[fct[[;; , 2]], # < 4 &], Times @@ fct[[;;, 1]], Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 4, print1(vecprod(f[, 1]), ", ")));}

name: The powerful part of the n-th biquadratefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Vaclav Kotesovec, Graph - the asymptotic ratio (100000000 terms)
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^If[e > 1, e, 0]; s[n_] := Module[{fct = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[fct[[;; , 2]], # < 4 &], Times @@ f @@@ fct, Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 4, print1(prod(i = 1, #f~, f[i, 1]^if(f[i, 2] > 1, f[i, 2], 0)), ", ")));}
xref: Similar sequences: A382902, A382903, A382904, A382905.
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 08 2025
